summary:
I am a graphic designer with a which-medium-fits-best attitude. The concept of a design should be strong, its form should be sparkling and outstanding. I work with clients from a broad variety of disciplines. I work on commercial, cultural and non profit projects. My preference is to work in the field of culture and design. If you are interested to work with me or to say hi, feel free to send me a message.

Visit my website and take a look at my portfolio: www.danadijkgraaf.nl

awards.title: European Design Awards - Bronze 2022
awards.description: For the dream team project Cadeau, hoezo? (exhibition at Tropenmuseum Amsterdam), we have won a bronze European Design Award. Exhibition design: Maison the Faux, Graphic Design: me, and many other parties were involved.

awards.title: European Design Awards - Silver 2022
awards.description: For the book AetA I have won an international Silver European Design Award.

awards.title: European Design Awards - Silver 2022
awards.description: For the flyer I designed for the renowned paper company Fedrigoni, I have won an international Silver European Design Award.

awards.title: Bep van de Velden Award - Finalist 2020
awards.description: Super trots om te kunnen delen dat ik als één van de tien onderneemsters was genomineerd voor de allereerste Bep van de Velden award in 2020! De uitreiking was in 2021 en met plezier heb ik als een van de drie finalisten mogen pitchen. Meer over de award: https://bepvandeveldenaward.nl/

awards.title: European Design Award Gold 2019
awards.description:
I won a Golden European Design Award in 2019, with the project In4nite. An prestige award, that I have always dreamed about to win sometime in my life! More information about the project:

https://europeandesign.org/submissions/in4nite/
https://www.danadijkgraaf.nl/projects/in4nite-ii-printed-matter/
https://www.bno.nl/blog/artikelen-10/post/hoe-is-het-met-dana-dijkgraaf-359

awards.title: European Design Awards 2015 - Nomination
awards.description: The magazine 'Logo is over' I designed for MOTI (Museum of the Image) was nominated for an European Design Award in 2015.

projects.title: Kleurboek voor Fondsenwervers
projects.description: I designed the newest book of Leo Dijkgraaf, a creative entrepreneur, who writes about creative thinking techniques and setting up a good brainstorm. In the book, Leo writes about three kind of ideas: a pink (challenging), a yellow (achievable) and a green (good) idea. The design of the book is in black and white and is embossed on the cover. The book is presented in a box with a textmarker with the three colors (pink, yellow and green) and with sticker sheets in the same neon colours. Photo's will follow, you can order the book at: http://dijkproducties.nl/publicaties.html

projects.title: Social Media Sweaters - Three sweaters: data, image, speech
projects.description:
This project is a result of my research at the digital identity in Social Media. Everyone talks to a avatar, rather than against a real life face with real emotions. 

In reality, the clothes you wear determines the identity which people will see from the outside. By creating the translation of the 'digital identity' of the internet into clothes, the identity that emerges on the internet appears in real life. 'The Social media sweaters' consists of a series of three sweaters. The first sweater shows my  'digital' database of friends, the second sweater shows all the pictures I'm tagged in and pictures I've placed by myself and the third sweater shows important information from me and texts I have said through social media.

projects.title: Mechanical Jungle - Poster installation with two tiny robots
projects.description:
Mechanical Jungle is a poster installation I made as a project for my finals. In this installation I designed a poster on which people could write down a word. After that, I put two little robots (Mr.Escape and Mr.Follow) on the poster and they run wild with their own marker while they are interacting with the black lines of the posters and with each other. The project is based on the vision of people as small mechanical radars of a huge machine: our society. 

For the movie of the project: https://vimeo.com/70176775

projects.title: Navid Nuur. The Value of Void II: the (un)written chapters - A three-dimensional installation
projects.description: Together with Jolijn Ceelen we made a three-dimensional installation for the Dutch Fine Artist Navid Nuur (Iran, 1976). We used the index of his book The Value of Void volume one, in which 9 chapters were crossed and used these chapters to create a grid which represented the second volume of The Value of Void. These 9 chapters in the grid formed new chapters, which we filled with sources of inspiration, studies and with elements which he has listed as his own periodical system. New worlds are revealed for the visitors to fantasise about. What can it become, what will it be. The unwritten chapters are written and presented without the presence of Navid Nuur. And he definitely was impressed when he saw his ficitional legacy when it was finished.

projects.title: All the Knives - performance exhibition
projects.description:
During my internship at Åbäke I worked on the exhibition All the Knives in Hasselt. The exhibition existed from a few things like a table, a Froebel Gift box, a gown, a few gloves and two performers. These performers told stories about the objects in their wallets (which are specially made for the exhibition at our art residency Frans Masereel Centre in Kasterlee, Belgium). Communication and to be more precise: speech, is a very important factor in this exhibition. 

For this exhibition I worked as a performer and as a graphic designer on the communication.  For the communication I designed an image with two cartoon clouds. One from an old and popular Belgian cartoon figure Kuifje and one modern one, the talk cloud we all know from Whatsapp. I also designed a typeface. 

http://www.danadijkgraaf.nl/miscellaneous/all-the-knives/

authors.headline: Freiberufliche Texterin und Journalistin bei Freelancer

profile_positions.description:
Dana Dijkgraaf (1990) is an award winning Graphic Designer and Art Director, based in Arnhem (NL). With her love for form, colours and well-thought-of-concepts, she comes up with design that sparkles and visualizes the story well.
 
She started in 2014 with her own studio Dana Dijkgraaf Design in Arnhem, and never stopped enjoying her work. She works for different industries: fashion, art, non-profit, art education, nature and corporate organizations. She has a fine network of professionals who can assist her to tackle every question and make high-quality work.

List of clients DDD worked for: Tropenmuseum Amsterdam, Stedelijk Museum Breda, Gemeente Amersfoort, Natuurcentrum Arnhem, Gemeente Arnhem, KOSMOS Uitgevers Antwerpen/Utrecht, ArtEZ University of the Arts, MOTI Museum of the Image in Breda, Le Far West, Maison the Faux, Studio Hands and Vakblad Fondsenwerving.

Interested in my work or to work with me? Visit my website for more info, and let's meet! 
https://www.danadijkgraaf.nl
https://www.instagram.com/danadijkgraafdesign/

profile_positions.title: Graphic Design Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: Ontwerp Platform Arnhem is a 'sharing design knowledge' platform in Arnhem, that organizes several public lectures during the year around different current topics. They are focused on sharing knowledge about culture & design (graphic, interaction, product, fashion), and invite well known and young designers from the field to present their ideas or work. Next to designers, they also invite other peoples when it fits the subject (journalists, philosophers etc) and they produce podcasts and interesting articles on their website.

Ontwerp Platform Arnhem is a 'sharing design knowledge' platform in Arnhem, that organizes several public lectures during the year around different current topics. They are focused on sharing knowledge about culture & design (graphic, interaction, product, fashion), and invite well known and young designers from the field to present their ideas or work. Next to designers, they also invite other peoples when it fits the subject (journalists, philosophers etc). 

As a member of the program board, I help to form the program of speakers and themes for the year.

I have helped with the communication of the Dierenvoedselbank Midden Gelderland and created a campaign (poster, flyer, digital images). 

For the campaign I made an attractive and funny image with cats eating typography made of cat yogurt. It's my belief, that when you create  a campaign for a rather sad subject, you better can seek attention with humor and beauty than showing the obvious and show something sad.
